# tableView(_:dropSessionDidExit:)

**Instance Method**

Notifies the delegate when dragged content exits the table view’s bounds rectangle.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func tableView(_ tableView: UITableView, dropSessionDidExit session: any UIDropSession)
```

## Parameters

- **tableView**: The collection view that was tracking the dragged content.
- **session**: The drop session object containing information about the data being dragged.

## Discussion

The table view calls this method when dragged content exits its bounds rectangle. This method isn’t called again until the dragged content enters the table view’s bounds (triggering a call to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDropDelegate/tableView(_:dropSessionDidEnter:)] method) and exits again.

Use this method to clean up any state information that you configured in your [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDropDelegate/tableView(_:dropSessionDidEnter:)] method.

## Tracking the drag movements

- **tableView(_:dropSessionDidUpdate:withDestinationIndexPath:)**: Proposes how to handle a drop at the specified location in the table view.
- **tableView(_:dropSessionDidEnter:)**: Notifies the delegate when dragged content enters the table view’s bounds rectangle.
- **tableView(_:dropSessionDidEnd:)**: Notifies the delegate when the drag operation ends.
